page.title: 11SHILDON SCHOOLS-1
page.content: Shildon has 6 schools. Sunnydale Comprehensive admits all of the 11 to 16 age group in the town.It was built approx.20 years ago. The 5 other schools are Primary. Shildon County school has 190 children and is housed in a modernised building about 60 years old.It was originally an Infants school,but due to falling rolls the Junior school which occupied the same site was converted into Training Workshops for the unemployed 3 years ago and the Infants school became a 4-11 Primary school.Timothy Hackworth School was built in 1911,and two buildings existed on the same site,one housing an Infant school, the other both a Junior school and a Girls Sec. Mod. school.Reorganisation in the early and late 70's led to the transfer of the Sec. schoolto the Comp.and the joining of the I&J.school
